xxl.core.relational.cursors

Class InputStreamMetaDataCursor

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor<E>
      • xxl.core.cursors.sources.io.InputStreamCursor<Tuple>
        • xxl.core.relational.cursors.InputStreamMetaDataCursor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterator<Tuple>, Cursor<Tuple>, MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>

    public class InputStreamMetaDataCursor
extends InputStreamCursor<Tuple>
implements MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
    This class constructs a metadata cursor for a given input stream, file or URL.

    The first row of the input stream must contain all the column names delimited by a string of columnDelimiters (the default column delimiter is "\t"). Thereafter a string of rowDelimiters must follow (the default row delimiter is "\r\n"). The second row must contain the column types (also delimited by a string of columnDelimiters). The possible column types are:

    • NUMBER (NUMERIC),
    • SMALLINT,
    • INTEGER,
    • BIGINT,
    • DOUBLE,
    • DATE,
    • TIME,
    • TIMESTAMP,
    • BIT,
    • VARCHAR and
    • VARBINARY.
    The type VARCHAR is set to VARCHAR(40) by default. Thereafter two strings of row delimiters must follow, i.e., the relational metadata definition is followed by an empty row.

    The first three rows of the input stream are case insensitive (the header). All following rows are case sensitive. Each of the following rows represents a tuple of this relation. Values are delimited by the strings of columnDelimiters, rows by the strings of rowDelimiters. Note that every row (in particular the last row) must be followed by a row delimiter to be read from the input stream. To model a SQL NULL value one must use the nullRepresentation. The string nullRepresentation is by default set to "#".

    Example for a file: 

       key     NAME        first name  year of birth
   Number  Varchar     varChar     number
   
   1       Tiger       Scott       1957
   2       Smith       Scott       1961
   3       Smith       John        1948
   4       #           Test        #
    By passing the file name to the constructor, the specified file can be used as a metadata cursor.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected String[] columnDelimiters
      The strings that can be used for delimiting a column (i.e., a value of a tuple's column).
      protected CompositeMetaData<Object,Object> globalMetaData
      The metadata provided by the metadata cursor.
      protected Function<?,? extends InputStream> inputStreamFactory
      A function that returns a new input stream providing this cursor's data.
      protected String nullRepresentation
      The textual representation for SQL NULL values inside the given output stream.
      protected Converter<? extends ResultSetMetaData> resultSetMetaDataConverter
      The converter that is used for reading the cursor's relational metadata from the underlying input stream.
      protected String[] rowDelimiters
      The strings that can be used for delimiting a row (i.e., a tuple).
      protected Function<Object,? extends Tuple> tupleFactory
      A function that maps a list of objects (column values) and a to a new result tuple.

    • Method Detail

      • getResultSetMetaDataConverter

        public static Converter<ResultSetMetaData> getResultSetMetaDataConverter(Converter<Character> characterConverter,
                                                                         String[] columnDelimiters,
                                                                         String[] rowDelimiters)
        Returns a converter that is able to read and write result set metadata using the form specified above. The converter reads or writes three rows of metadata definition containing the column names, the column types and an empty row.
        Parameters:
        characterConverter - the converter used for converting the characters of the result set metadata's textual representation.
        columnDelimiters - the strings that can be used for delimiting a column.
        rowDelimiters - the strings that can be used for delimiting a row.
        Returns:
        a converter that is able to read and write result set metadata using the form specified above.

      • getTupleConverter

        public static Converter<Tuple> getTupleConverter(Converter<Character> characterConverter,
                                                 String[] columnDelimiters,
                                                 String[] rowDelimiters,
                                                 String nullRepresentation,
                                                 ResultSetMetaData relationalMetaData,
                                                 Function<Object,? extends Tuple> tupleFactory)
        Returns a converter that is able to read and write tuples using the form specified above. The converter reads or writes a row of tuple values.
        Parameters:
        characterConverter - the converter used for converting the characters of the tuples' textual representation.
        columnDelimiters - the strings that can be used for delimiting a column (i.e., a value of a tuple's column).
        rowDelimiters - the strings that can be used for delimiting a row (i.e., a tuple).
        nullRepresentation - a textual representation for SQL NULL values inside the given output stream.
        relationalMetaData - the relational metadata of the tuples to be converted.
        tupleFactory - a function that maps a list of objects (column values) and a to a new result tuple. ArrayTuple.FACTORY_METHOD can be used as a default factory method.
        Returns:
        a converter that is able to read and write tuples using the form specified above.

                                       MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> cursor)
                                throws IOException
        Writes the given metadata cursor to the specified output stream using the given converters.
        Parameters:
        dataOutput - the output stream the given cursor's data and metadata is written to.
        resultSetMetaDataConverter - the converter that is used to write the given cursor's metadata.
        tupleConverter - the converter that is used to write the given cursor's data.
        cursor - the metadata cursor providing the data and metadata to be written.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Resets the cursor to its initial state such that the caller is able to traverse the underlying data structure again without constructing a new cursor (optional operation). The modifications, removes and updates concerning the underlying data structure, are still persistent.

        Note, that this operation is optional and does not work for this cursor.

        Specified by:
        reset in interface Cursor<Tuple>
        Overrides:
        reset in class AbstractCursor<Tuple>
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the reset operation is not supported by the cursor.

      • supportsReset

        public boolean supportsReset()
        Returns true if the reset operation is supported by the cursor. Otherwise it returns false.
        Specified by:
        supportsReset in interface Cursor<Tuple>
        Overrides:
        supportsReset in class AbstractCursor<Tuple>
        Returns:
        true if the reset operation is supported by the cursor, otherwise false.
